body:
@emmitt please start with filling the issue template. https://raw.github.com/owncloud/core/master/issue_template.md
thanks.

i have the same issue in owncloud 5.10.
 webserver is running debian unstable, php version 5.5.1+dfsg-2, apache version 2.4.6-2

to reproduce: log into owncloud (i'm running over ssl but that shouldn't matter), visit the calendar app, and hit the settings button on the right.

you'l see this backtrace:

---
 warning: cannot modify header information - headers already sent by (output started at /var/www/owncloud/lib/template.php:402) in /var/www/owncloud/lib/template.php on line 189
call stack
#	time	memory	function	location
1	0.0001	246160	{main}( )	../index.php:0
2	0.0090	490576	oc::handlerequest( )	../index.php:28
3	0.0975	1812360	oc_router->match( )	../base.php:620
4	0.1085	1911264	call_user_func ( )	../router.php:127
5	0.1085	1911352	oc::loadappscriptfile( )	../router.php:127
6	0.1108	1912272	require_once( '/var/www/owncloud/apps/calendar/settingswrapper.php' ) ../base.php:691
7	0.1450	1967864	require_once( '/var/www/owncloud/apps/calendar/settings.php' )../settingswrapper.php:3
8	0.1450	1968120	oc_template->__construct( )	../settings.php:9
9	0.1451	1968952	header ( )	../template.php:189

### expected behaviour
no errors in log about headers already sent. 

### actual behaviour
errors in log about headers already sent.

### steps to reproduce
1. install owncloud from source
2. use the calendar (having items and such)
3. click the calendar settings button
4. check owncloud.log

### server configuration
operating system: debian, testing

web server: apache 2.4.6-3

database: mysql 5.5.31+dfsg-1

php version: 5.5.3+dfsg-1

owncloud version: 5.0.11 (5.0.7 before)

### client configuration
browser: firefox/iceweasel and chromium

operating system: debian, testing

### logs
#### web server error log
(obfuscated)

#### browser log
nothing appropiate found

yeah, please fix it, my log gets filled too.

the problem is easy to see: settingswrapper.php uses two oc_template objects (/lib/template.php). these objects start sending http headers in their constructor. the second template object fails doing this, because the first one already started its output.
someone already suggested a fix: owncloud/calendar#126
